jobs.title: Account Executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Rose Rocket 🚀 is a market leader in Transportation Management Software. We’re a startup going after the $700+ billion dollar trucking industry, leading the shift to SaaS while revolutionizing the way trucking companies sell, service, and innovate. We are a “more human, less corporate” culture that is built around doing work that matters, winning as a team, and celebrating success. We’d love to hear from you if you want to build this with us.

We understand that joining a team is one of the most important decisions you make ❤️, and adding a team member is one of the most important decisions we’ll make. Through our process, we want you to get to know us and understand how you approach problems, learn, and what motivates you. 

About the Role
As an Account Executive, you will play a key role in driving revenue and expanding Rose Rocket’s presence in the market. You’ll manage the full sales cycle from prospecting and qualification through to demo, negotiation, and close through renewal and retention of your book of business. The right candidate will combine strong sales fundamentals with curiosity about how our customers operate and the adaptability to thrive in a fast-moving environment.

What You’ll Do

  • Build and manage a healthy pipeline of prospective customers, primarily within the trucking and logistics space.

  • Conduct consultative discovery calls and product demonstrations with key decision-makers.

  • Develop a deep understanding of customer pain points and position Rose Rocket as a platform that solves real operational challenges.

  • Partner closely with marketing and solutions teams to deliver tailored world-class buying experiences and a smooth post-sale transition.

  • Consistently meet and exceed sales targets while maintaining accurate pipeline forecasts and reporting in our CRM.

  • Provide feedback from customers to internal teams to help shape our product and sales strategy.

  • Work cross functionally with our FDS team to ensure successful implementation of your customer & maintain executive level relationships.

  • Stay informed on logistics industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitive products.

  • Manage your book of business, with customer renewals & growth of account

What You Bring

  • Three or more years of success in a SaaS sales role, ideally in logistics, transportation, supply chain, or a related industry.

  • A consistent record of meeting or exceeding quota in full-cycle sales roles.
    Strong prospecting ability and comfort generating your own pipeline.

  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to lead strategic conversations with senior stakeholders.

  • High resilience, adaptability, and comfort operating in a rapidly changing environment.

  • A team-first mindset with the ability to work independently and take initiative.

  • Curiosity and a desire to deeply understand how our customers’ businesses run.

Nice to Have

  • Experience selling to carriers, brokers, or logistics providers.

  • Knowledge of transportation workflows such as dispatching, billing, and fleet management.

  • Familiarity with CRM systems like Hubspot and modern sales tools.

  • Experience working in a startup or high-growth company.

Why Join Rose Rocket
You’ll be joining a company that is changing how freight moves. The work you do will have a tangible impact on an industry that keeps the economy running. We offer a competitive base salary with a performance-based structure and strong opportunities for growth. You’ll have the freedom to make decisions, the support of a collaborative team, and the satisfaction of seeing your work drive real customer success.

We’re moving quickly on this search and hope to welcome our next team member as soon as possible, ideally in our November or December onboarding cohort.

Don’t sweat it if you don’t have everything listed above. We believe in growth and curiosity. If you have some of these qualities and are excited about this opportunity, then we want to hear from you!

Perks & Benefits at Rose Rocket

🏥 A comprehensive benefits program + health care spending account

🐣 Parental leave top-up - read about it here

💰 Stock option plan

💻 A Macbook and a sweet tech equipment combo to get you started

🏝 Start with three weeks of vacation (with an option to purchase an additional week every year) + winter holidays office closure and 3 personal days!

💼 Downtown Toronto office complete with an in-house coffee shop, music room, library and a few other lifestyle perks that keep our days fun

Equal Employment Opportunity

Rose Rocket does not discriminate in hiring or terms and conditions of employment because of an individual’s race, ancestry, colour, place of origin, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, sexual orientation, family status or marital status, or any other protected category recognized by provincial or federal laws.

Should you require any accommodation, please inform us and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. For any accessibility-related assistance, requests for information in accessible alternative formats or to report any accessibility problems, please share in your application or email careers@roserocket.com.

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Rose Rocket 🚀 is a market leader in Transportation Management Software. We’re a startup going after the $700+ billion dollar trucking industry, leading the shift to SaaS while revolutionizing the way trucking companies sell, service, and innovate. We are a “more human, less corporate” culture that is built around doing work that matters, winning as a team, and celebrating success. We’d love to hear from you if you want to build this with us.

We understand that joining a team is one of the most important decisions you make ❤️, and adding a team member is one of the most important decisions we’ll make. Through our process, we want you to get to know us and understand how you approach problems, learn, and what motivates you. 

The Position

We are seeking an Allbound Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our Go-to-Market team. As an Allbound SDR, you’ll own the top of the funnel: qualifying inbound leads, driving outbound prospecting into target accounts, and creating meaningful first impressions with Rose Rocket’s TMS.

This role is about pipeline creation. You’ll balance speed and care in responding to inbound leads with creativity and persistence in outbound prospecting. You’ll uncover prospect needs through discovery, book qualified meetings for Account Executives, and ensure every interaction leaves prospects with a positive impression of Rose Rocket.

The ideal candidate is motivated, resilient, and eager to learn. You have experience in outbound calling or prospecting, and you’re ready to expand into a hybrid role that combines inbound responsiveness with outbound hustle.

Why we’re excited about this role

The trucking industry is a cornerstone of our economy, yet it’s been underserved by modern software. Rose Rocket has spent 8 years building solutions that make trucking companies more efficient and connected. As an SDR, you’ll play a direct role in opening doors and helping us deliver that change to more businesses.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage all top-of-funnel activities: inbound lead qualification, outbound prospecting, and follow-up from events/marketing campaigns

  • Represent Rose Rocket at industry events and field marketing activities (travel required ~10%)

  • Respond to inbound leads with urgency, qualifying fit and booking meetings for Account Executives

  • Research and prospect into target accounts using calls, emails, LinkedIn, and other channels

  • Conduct discovery to understand prospect pain points and opportunities before AE handoff

  • Maintain accurate notes and data integrity in CRM systems

  • Provide feedback to sales and marketing teams on lead quality, messaging, and campaign effectiveness

  • Share insights from prospect interactions to help refine outbound strategies

What you’ll need to be successful

  • 1+ year experience in an outbound sales or prospecting role (transportation/logistics experience a plus)

  • Comfort with high-volume outbound activity (cold calling, emailing, social outreach)

  • Ability to qualify inbound leads quickly and thoughtfully

  • Experience working with a CRM (HubSpot, Salesforce, etc.)

  • Experience with field marketing and representing a company at industry events and trade shows, including willingness to travel up to 10% of the time

  • Resilience and adaptability in a fast-moving sales environment

  • Track record of meeting or exceeding individual quotas or activity targets

  • Strong communication skills and ability to tailor messaging to different personas

  • Team-first mindset with a hunger to learn and grow into more senior sales roles

Don’t sweat it if you don’t have everything listed above. We believe in growth and curiosity. If you have some of these qualities and are excited about this opportunity, then we want to hear from you!

Perks & Benefits at Rose Rocket

🏥 A comprehensive benefits program + health care spending account

🐣 Parental leave top-up - read about it here

💰 Stock option plan

💻 A Macbook and a sweet tech equipment combo to get you started

🏝 Start with three weeks of vacation (with an option to purchase an additional week every year) + winter holidays office closure and 3 personal days!

💼 Downtown Toronto office complete with an in-house coffee shop, music room, library and a few other lifestyle perks that keep our days fun

Equal Employment Opportunity

Rose Rocket does not discriminate in hiring or terms and conditions of employment because of an individual’s race, ancestry, colour, place of origin, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, sexual orientation, family status or marital status, or any other protected category recognized by provincial or federal laws.

Should you require any accommodation, please inform us and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. For any accessibility-related assistance, requests for information in accessible alternative formats or to report any accessibility problems, please share in your application or email careers@roserocket.com.

jobs.title: Associate Product Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Rose Rocket 🚀 is a market leader in Transportation Management Software. We’re a startup going after the $700+ billion dollar trucking industry, leading the shift to SaaS while revolutionizing the way trucking companies sell, service, and innovate. We are a “more human, less corporate” culture that is built around doing work that matters, winning as a team, and celebrating success. We’d love to hear from you if you want to build this with us.

We understand that joining a team is one of the most important decisions you make ❤️, and adding a team member is one of the most important decisions we’ll make. Through our process, we want you to get to know us and understand how you approach problems, learn, and what motivates you. 

Launch Your Product Career at the Heart of Innovation!

Are you a builder who's passionate about solving real problems with technology? At Rose Rocket, we're seeking an ambitious Associate Product Manager to join our dynamic product team. This is a unique opportunity for someone with engineering or development experience to transition into product management while working on projects that directly impact how the transportation industry operates. You'll work closely with our Director of Product Management on high-impact initiatives that could span platform development, customer-facing features, or cross-organizational collaboration tools.

What You'll Do:

  • Drive Real Impact: Own end-to-end product initiatives from discovery through delivery, working on projects that solve genuine customer problems in the transportation industry.

  • Bridge Technical and Business: Leverage your development background to work seamlessly with engineering teams while translating business needs into technical requirements.

  • Learn and Grow: Work directly with our Director of Product Management and experienced PMs to develop core product management skills including user research, roadmap planning, and stakeholder management.

  • Customer Connection: Engage directly with customers to understand their workflows, pain points, and needs - potentially including on-site visits and customer interviews.

  • Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Partner with engineering, design, sales, and customer success teams to ensure successful product delivery and adoption.

  • Embrace AI-Native Thinking: Help shape how AI capabilities can enhance our platform and create new value for customers in an AI-first world.

Why You'll Love Working Here:

  • Ownership & Growth: Take on meaningful projects from day one with direct mentorship from experienced product leaders. Your work will have an immediate impact on our customers and business.

  • Learning Culture: Join a team that values curiosity, experimentation, and continuous improvement. We'll invest in your growth as you transition into product management.

  • Dynamic Environment: Work on diverse projects across our platform - from core infrastructure to customer-facing features to cutting-edge AI integrations.

  • Hands-On Technical Impact: Leverage your engineering experience to contribute code directly to our application layer, building customer-specific solutions on top of our platform. You'll use AI tools to accelerate development while delivering immediate value through custom implementations.

  • Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy the best of both worlds with 3 days in our vibrant downtown Toronto office and 2 days working remotely.

What You Bring:

  • Technical Foundation: Engineering, computer science, or development background with hands-on experience building software projects (personal projects, internships, or professional experience).

  • Builder Mindset: You've created things - whether it's apps, websites, scripts, or other technical projects that demonstrate your ability to turn ideas into reality.

  • Customer Obsession: Genuine interest in working closely with customers to understand their workflows, challenges, and needs. You're energized by customer conversations and see them as the key to building better products.

  • AI-Native Approach: Comfortable with AI tools and thinking about how AI can enhance products and workflows. You see AI as a natural part of the development process.

  • Action-Oriented: You're someone who rolls up their sleeves and gets things done. You prefer moving fast and iterating rather than endless planning.

  • Communication Skills: Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and translate business requirements into technical specifications.

  • Curiosity and Learning: Eager to understand customer problems, market dynamics, and business strategy. You ask great questions and aren't afraid to dive deep.

  • Collaborative Spirit: You work well with others and can build relationships across different teams and functions.

Bonus Points If You Have:

  • Experience with TypeScript or modern web development

  • Previous internships or co-op experience in product or engineering roles

  • Experience with agile development methodologies

  • Interest in B2B software or logistics/transportation industry

Don’t sweat it if you don’t have everything listed above. We believe in growth and curiosity. If you have some of these qualities and are excited about this opportunity, then we want to hear from you!

Perks & Benefits at Rose Rocket

🏥 A comprehensive benefits program + health care spending account

🐣 Parental leave top-up - read about it here

💰 Stock option plan

💻 A Macbook and a sweet tech equipment combo to get you started

🏝 Start with three weeks of vacation (with an option to purchase an additional week every year) + winter holidays office closure and 3 personal days!

💼 Downtown Toronto office complete with an in-house coffee shop, music room, library and a few other lifestyle perks that keep our days fun

Equal Employment Opportunity

Rose Rocket does not discriminate in hiring or terms and conditions of employment because of an individual’s race, ancestry, colour, place of origin, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, sexual orientation, family status or marital status, or any other protected category recognized by provincial or federal laws.

jobs.title: Customer Support Representative
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Rose Rocket 🚀 is a market leader in Transportation Management Software. We’re a startup going after the $700+ billion dollar trucking industry, leading the shift to SaaS while revolutionizing the way trucking companies sell, service, and innovate. We are a “more human, less corporate” culture that is built around doing work that matters, winning as a team, and celebrating success. We’d love to hear from you if you want to build this with us.

We understand that joining a team is one of the most important decisions you make ❤️, and adding a team member is one of the most important decisions we’ll make. Through our process, we want you to get to know us and understand how you approach problems, learn, and what motivates you. 

We are looking for an experienced support and services professional to join our RevOps team as a Customer Support Representative! In this role, you will be representing the voice of the customer throughout Rose Rocket, while helping our customers throughout their day-to-day operations with agility and care. You will be providing high quality service to our customers and helping our team achieve business goals, while contributing to various projects to level up our customer experience.

This is an incredibly exciting time at Rose Rocket and this role will give you the opportunity to make a direct impact on our users’ experience every day.

Responsibilities

  • Responding to inbound inquiries from Rose Rocket customers via email, live chat and phone.

  • Diagnose and resolve customer issues by using product knowledge, internal resources, and escalation paths.

  • Deliver customer feedback to our Product/Engineering teams to improve the product

  • Leverage AI tools to increase team efficiency

  • Consistently meeting or exceeding service KPIs such as Time to First Response, Time to Resolution and CSAT.

  • Work closely with the team to maintain our help center, product releases, address critical issues, case escalations, incident/crisis management, or other work that impacts our customers and our business.

  • Have a continuous improvement mindset and an abundance of ideas.

Requirements

  • 1-3 years of experience in customer support preferably with SaaS technologies and bonus points for experience in the trucking industry

  • Have proven success in achieving or exceeding performance goals.

  • Have a passion for incredible customer service, exceptional communication (verbal, written, and listening) and excellent people skills.

  • Demonstrate incredible attention to detail and have an analytical and technical mindset that helps you meticulously understand, evaluate, and solve issues quickly, efficiently and accurately.

  • You are a proven reliable resource to your team members, fellow employees, and your peers. You are approachable, professional, and thorough in all that you do.

Extra Credit

Here are a few points that while not required will help you stand out!

  • Customer training/onboarding experience

  • Project management experience - have you ever helped manage a work-related project? (big or small!)

  • Experience working with CRM Tickets (Hubspot or Salesforce)

Don’t sweat it if you don’t have everything listed above. We believe in growth and curiosity. If you have some of these qualities and are excited about this opportunity, then we want to hear from you!

Perks & Benefits at Rose Rocket

🏥 A comprehensive benefits program + health care spending account

In this role, you will be representing the voice of the customer throughout Rose Rocket, while helping our customers throughout their day-to-day operations with agility and care. You will be providing high quality service to our customers and helping our team achieve business goals, while contributing to various projects to level up our customer experience.

This is an incredibly exciting time at Rose Rocket and this role will give you the opportunity to make a direct impact on our users’ experience every day.


RESPONSIBILITIES

 - Responding to inbound inquiries from Rose Rocket customers via email, live chat and phone.

 - Diagnose and resolve customer issues by using product knowledge, internal resources, and escalation paths.

 - Deliver customer feedback to our Product/Engineering teams to improve the product

 - Leverage AI tools to increase team efficiency

 - Consistently meeting or exceeding service KPIs such as Time to First Response, Time to Resolution and CSAT.

 - Work closely with the team to maintain our help center, product releases, address critical issues, case escalations, incident/crisis management, or other work that impacts our customers and our business.

 - Have a continuous improvement mindset and an abundance of ideas.


REQUIREMENTS

 - 1-3 years of experience in customer support preferably with SaaS technologies and bonus points for experience in the trucking industry

 - Have proven success in achieving or exceeding performance goals.

 - Have a passion for incredible customer service, exceptional communication (verbal, written, and listening) and excellent people skills.

 - Demonstrate incredible attention to detail and have an analytical and technical mindset that helps you meticulously understand, evaluate, and solve issues quickly, efficiently and accurately.

 - You are a proven reliable resource to your team members, fellow employees, and your peers. You are approachable, professional, and thorough in all that you do.


EXTRA CREDIT

Here are a few points that while not required will help you stand out!

 - Customer training/onboarding experience

 - Project management experience - have you ever helped manage a work-related project? (big or small!)

jobs.title: Junior Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Rose Rocket 🚀 is a market leader in Transportation Management Software. We’re a startup going after the $700+ billion dollar trucking industry, leading the shift to SaaS while revolutionizing the way trucking companies sell, service, and innovate. We are a “more human, less corporate” culture that is built around doing work that matters, winning as a team, and celebrating success. We’d love to hear from you if you want to build this with us.

We understand that joining a team is one of the most important decisions you make ❤️, and adding a team member is one of the most important decisions we’ll make. Through our process, we want you to get to know us and understand how you approach problems, learn, and what motivates you. 

We are looking for a Junior Software Engineer who is eager to join a dynamic, innovative team and make a real impact in the fast-paced logistics industry. We are an AI Native Engineering organization and are trailblazing software development practices that integrate deeply and pragmatically with the latest AI tools.

Join us in building the backbone of Rose Rocket's next-gen logistics platform! Whether you're creating the scalable frameworks that power our system or using those tools to deliver customer-facing features, you'll work with cutting-edge tech that's transforming the logistics industry. You'll design, build, and ship high-impact functionality—from platform foundations to the features that directly solve our customers' toughest problems.

Why you'll love this job:

  • Work alongside experienced engineers in a mentorship-driven environment where learning is built into how we work.

  • Deliver key features from concept to delivery and see how your work directly enhances the world of trucking.

  • Collaborate with product-focused, cross-functional teams that encourage experimentation and continuous growth.

  • Experiment and learn with the latest AI-assisted coding tools and integrate them into your day-to-day workflow.

Technologies that we use (that you'll be exposed to):

  • Backend: NodeJS, NestJS, Typescript

  • Frontend: React, Redux, Websockets

  • Database: PostgreSQL, Redis, DynamoDB, Elasticsearch

  • Infrastructure: AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Github actions

What you need to succeed:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer or Software Engineering, or a related field.

  • Experience with AI-assisted coding tools (Claude, Cursor, Cline, Windsurf) - or eagerness to learn them.

  • Experience with agile project management tools (JIRA, Asana, Linear, or equivalent).

  • Proficiency with Git and have a solid understanding of version control best practices.

Don’t sweat it if you don’t have everything listed above. We believe in growth and curiosity. If you have some of these qualities and are excited about this opportunity, then we want to hear from you!
